Module chav1961.purelib
Package chav1961.purelib.fsys

Class FileSystemOnFileSystem

java.lang.Object
chav1961.purelib.fsys.AbstractFileSystem
chav1961.purelib.fsys.FileSystemOnFileSystem
All Implemented Interfaces:
SpiService<FileSystemInterface>, FileSystemInterface, FileSystemInterfaceDescriptor, java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.lang.Cloneable
public class FileSystemOnFileSystem
extends AbstractFileSystem
implements FileSystemInterfaceDescriptor

This class implements the file system interface on the standard file system mechanism in the Java 1.7 and later. The URI to use this class is URI.create("fsys:filesystem_specific_url"); (for example URI.create("fsys:jar:./myJar.jar");)

This class is not thread-safe.

Since:
0.0.1
Author:
Alexander Chernomyrdin aka chav1961
See Also:
FileSystem, FileSystemInterface, JUnit tests
LastUpdate:
0.0.3

    • FileSystemOnFileSystem

      public FileSystemOnFileSystem()

      This constructor is an entry for the SPI service only. Don't use it in any purposes

    • FileSystemOnFileSystem

      public FileSystemOnFileSystem​(java.net.URI rootPath) throws java.io.IOException

      Create the file system for the given file system type and path

      .
      Parameters:
      rootPath - root directory for the file system. Need be absolute URI with the schema 'fsys:filesystemtype:', for example 'fsys:jar:c:/mydir'
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if any exception was thrown

      public void close() throws java.io.IOException
      Description copied from class: AbstractFileSystem

    • createDataWrapper

      public DataWrapperInterface createDataWrapper​(java.net.URI actualPath) throws java.io.IOException
      Description copied from interface: FileSystemInterface

      Get data wrapper interface for the given file system cursor path

      Specified by:
      createDataWrapper in interface FileSystemInterface
      Specified by:
      createDataWrapper in class AbstractFileSystem
      Parameters:
      actualPath - path toget data wrapper for. Always is relative, normalized and always starts with the '/'.
      Returns:
      data wrapper for the actual path. Never can be null. If object with the given path is not exists, you need at least fill the ATR_EXISTS attribute for the getAttributes() method call.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if any exceptions was thrown

    • getUriTemplate

      public java.net.URI getUriTemplate()
      Description copied from interface: FileSystemInterfaceDescriptor

      Get URI template for the given driver. URI must be absolute and contain at least File system URI scheme and this diver sub-scheme. It's strongly recommended to use URI pointed to root of the file system (path content contains '/' only)

      Specified by:
      getUriTemplate in interface FileSystemInterfaceDescriptor
      Returns:
      URI template. Can't be null

    • testConnection

      public boolean testConnection​(java.net.URI connection, LoggerFacade logger) throws java.io.IOException
      Description copied from interface: FileSystemInterfaceDescriptor

      Test connection to the given file system with the given URI

      Specified by:
      testConnection in interface FileSystemInterfaceDescriptor
      Parameters:
      connection - URI to connect to the file system. Must be absolute and it's scheme and sub-scheme must match URi returned by FileSystemInterfaceDescriptor.getUriTemplate() method
      logger - logger to print connection messages to
      Returns:
      true is connection successful, false otherwise
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - any problems on connection
